conclusion: Determine particle's acceleration from x vs t² graph
Vertical axis: position x in meters; Horizontal axis: t² in s²; Graph is a straight line from (0, 6) to (2, 0)
Equation of line: x = mx(t²) + b
Equation relating position and t²: x = -3t² + 6
Standard kinematic equation: x = x₀ + v₀t + ½at²
At t = 0, particle is at rest and at position x₀ = 6 m
Comparing equations: x = 6 + ½a·t² and x = -3t² + 6
Solve for acceleration: ½a = -3, so a = -6 m/s²
Acceleration is negative, indicating movement toward origin
Final answer: Magnitude of particle's acceleration is 6 m/s²
